intro: Toxocarpus africanus, commonly known as the African starleaf, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its star-shaped leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in forested areas and is often found in moist, shaded environments. The botanical features of Toxocarpus africanus make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
